channel.title: JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [GET-127] Request additional data on Order Lookup Page
item.description:
The updated order lookup page design requires certain information that is not currently available on the frontend. The expectation is that we will need to make an additional request to the Netsuite team to extend this information for our team to pull into the Order Lookup page.

Currently returned data

Ship Date
Freight Cost
Total Cost
Quantity
Order Status
Tracking Number
Zoro #
Order Date
Ship Method
Service (Carrier)

Additional data to return

Product Image
Product Title
Total Price (item level)
Shipping Address
Billing Address
Payment Info
Subtotal
Discounts
Shipping Cost
Tax
Order Total
Order Number
item.summary: Request additional data on Order Lookup Page

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment:
Is there a contract for this endpoint?
If so we should send the updated contract as part of the request.
If not we should create a contract.
Having a contract will allow us to create mock data confidently and start working on the stories before the netsuite team is done with their update.

customfield.customfieldname: If necessary, did you include all output documentation in the ticket?

item.title: [GET-117] Account Name & Customer # in Flyout Should Link to My Account
item.description:
As a authenticated use

I want to click on the account name or customer # in the menu flyout

So that I can be linked to My Account page

This area of the header is by far the most used by customers but currently is static text. We should take users to their My Account page so they can continue to navigate through their account.
item.summary: Account Name & Customer # in Flyout Should Link to My Account

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment: FYI GET team is planning this related work for the upcoming sprint:https://zorotools.atlassian.net/browse/GET-107[https://zorotools.atlassian.net/browse/GET-107|https://zorotools.atlassian.net/browse/GET-107|smart-link]

Need to determine what label to use for account name hyperlink

data-analytics="['Navigation', 'flyout-account', '???']"
Mark Guagenti Any answer regarding label for account name hyperlink? ��

Andre Alforque Confirmed with the team. We will use same label as the current overview link data-analytics="['Navigation', 'flyout-account', 'My Account']"

Thanks!
Morghan Buhrman Reaching out to others to assure ADA compliance.
Andre Alforque We’ve added a new AC for the hover state recommendation
Per Mark Guagenti in comment below, will use following data-analytics attribute: data-analytics="['Navigation', 'flyout-account', 'My Account']
Need to review/add/update unit tests and investigate click stream tagging.

Per Mark Guagenti , Clickstream tagging and analytics tagging ACs are the same thing. removing clickstream from AC.

Reviewing tests.
Ready for QA as part get-107, have notified Melanie Maerz Harsh Tyagi

customfield.customfieldname: If necessary, did you include all output documentation in the ticket?

item.title: [GET-107] Account Menu - Design Update/Add Subcopy
item.description:
As a logged-in customer, I want to know which link in the account menu will direct me to order tracking and return information.

Per Andy Gorman (aligned with UXR and Matt Hertzman): Launch and monitor. No A/B Test. NOTE: Needs to have Returns ( GET-49 Done ) tickets in place.

Pages / Components / Modals

  1. Account Menu

Functionality

  • Swap the position of Account Overview and Order History
  • Add "Tracking, Returns" subcopy underneath the Order History heading to indicate to the user what they can do in that space
  • Remove the Order Tracking navigation item and add it as subcopy under Order History
  • Add hairline in between Order History and Account Overview
  • For an authenticated account, change the name display to “Hi, Firstname” (currently including both first and last names).

Design

https://www.figma.com/file/Oh3Q6b7qezbgPVwaIHabVl/Returns?node-id=2046%3A85243

See Figma link for hover states

Approach

  • Place behind LaunchDarkly feature flag
  • Are the current different links hitting a different event?
  • Maintain current hover state
  • Content Square?

Dependencies

  • Analytics
    • Combining acc-menu-08 and acc-menu-12
    • Does ordering of items affect tracking/metrics?
  • Subtitles/subcopy are new style
  • https://zorotools.atlassian.net/browse/GET-49 must be in Production; either launch this ticket with https://zorotools.atlassian.net/browse/GET-49, or afterwards.

Notes

Before/After Metrics TBD

TEST NOTES
Applies to both NS and CT Users.
1. Validate the order of elements under Account Overview: 1. Name / Customer Number, 2. Reorder Items, 3. Order History, 4. Account Overview, 5. Customer Service, 6. Sign Out.
2. Validate Tracking, Returns appears under Order History.
3. Validate Order Tracking no longer appears.
4. Validate there is a thin line separating Order History section and Account Overview.
5. Validate My Account panel (when user is signed in) shows “Hi, FirstName”

status.description: The Product Owner has approved work, and the QA team can begin regression and other testing

comments.comment: FYI Manage team is planning on building https://zorotools.atlassian.net/browse/MANAGE-227in the upcoming sprint

Removed Order Tracking button, added caption to order history button.

Also made changes that aren’t part of the ticket per Morghan Buhrman to remove the bottom padding of the menu list element. Trim’d.
Passed local tests and lint. Need answers on what if anything analytics would like done with the tracking info on now-removed tracking button.
Have reached out to analytics regarding removal of button.
Analytic Specs Here

Removing the following item from AC checklist as it belongs on get-117: “Authenticated account menu greeting (Hi, company name / Hi firstname) has underline effect on hover”.

Assigning get-117 subtask to myself.
thanks
Environment: https://getb-www.zoro.com/
Added Test Notes (validation points based on AC), moved to In Testing, Assigned to Harsh Tyagi Thanks!
Testing for desktop done today. Will continue with mobile testing.

Jake Hamilton Melanie Maerz This looks good. It’s just the hover action that is not working in the mobile (simulator) as it would on the PC. I wonder if this is because I am testing it on a simulator. If I try to do a slightly longer press the hover effect seems to be working as it should. I would like to know your thought before proceeding. Please see the attached video for reference.

Harsh Tyagi Hey Harsh, mobile shouldn’t have hover unless long pressed (since with touch its either press or nothing). let me run it by our designer real fast to make sure Im thinking of this right and follow up.
Harsh Tyagi Confirmed that should be no hover underline on mobile.
Jake Hamilton Thank you for confirming. The updates look good. QA complete.
Ready to merge but delaying merge until get-49, 94, 96, 97 are no longer under feature flag.

item.title: [GET-75] Track My Order Details Page
item.description:
When customers lookup their order using /Track-my-order page, they currently only see the Delivery status of their order based on the tracking number. This provides no detail regarding the order details itself, and no affordance to other self-serve order mgmt features like Returns.

However, we’re able to retrieve more helpful order details to the Track page. See Get-64 for order data retrieval.

Story: As a customer tracking their order, I want to view more details about my order so I can manage my order if I need to without having to go somewhere else.

How might we show the customer more details about their order including supporting the following intents:

  1. Can see multiple tracking statuses if there is more than one shipment per their order.
  2. Can view the order number, and items in the order, and relevant content for each item in the order (similar to Order History/Sales Order list.)
  3. Can initiate return at the line item level (similar to new Returns treatment).
  4. (Exploration) If item has not shipped allow for cancelation request.

https://zorotools.atlassian.net/browse/GET-64

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment: Jake Hamilton to create skeleton page with data. Knowledge transfer regarding NS data / functionality powering the feature.

Created GuestOrderDetailPage, added route for it, pulled in the order querying code from OrderHistoryPage; however, need access to commerce tools in order to make orders trackable (at least status of shipped) and see what kind of data is getting returned
Tested that order items query added to guest_order_loop.js is returning order items correctly in sb2

item.title: [GET-61] Pre-populate Contact Form with Returns data
item.description:
Extend front-end state mgmt/store to facilitate/enable cross-component state sharing for contact return form flow.

  • Added orderReturnDetail property to the store/user module to house returns data;
  • Added actions for components to set/modify user/orderReturns data;
  • Added getter for selecting user/orderReturns data;
  • Added getter for using querying other slices of the state for relevant order/product data;

Functionality (F)

Adds state and behavior to front-end store for managing and sharing data among relevant components during order return flow.

Notes

Added state and behavior to front-end store for managing and sharing data among relevant components during order return flow.
item.summary: Pre-populate Contact Form with Returns data

status.description: The Product Owner has approved work, and the QA team can begin regression and other testing

comments.comment: Jake Hamilton I have a mockup of the desired auto-populated form in this file https://www.figma.com/file/Oh3Q6b7qezbgPVwaIHabVl/Returns?node-id=1076%3A14445
On getA env
Getting this backend issue.

Jake Hamilton Andre Alforque Do we need https://zorotools.atlassian.net/browse/GET-49 in a running state to test this ticket ?

Also , a Heads up Kamya Singh will QA this ticket for us to help me work on the tickets that are already assigned to me in BUY team.
Harsh Tyagi Yes, this functionality is dependent on https://zorotools.atlassian.net/browse/GET-49 .
Based on recent discussion , the Contact Us auto-populate functionality is not ready , so we will keep QA on hold for it.
Currently testing it along/as part of GET-49 Done

Update from Alex: We've identified an issue with a microservice that determines what items are able to be returned through narvar and what items cannot. Currently items that should not be returnable, which are the ones that would have the contact customer service link, are being marked as returnable and thus have the wrong button and the wrong experience in narvar as well.

Until these microservice issues are fixed QA for get-49 will likely be blocked as the logic it depends upon is incomplete

09.12.22
Checked in with Jake/Alex: Microservice issues have not yet been resolved, so moving to In Progress and assigned back to Dev for now.
Added orderReturnItem vuex getter which finds and returns the item associated with the zoroNo stored in orderReturnDetail, or otherwise returns null.
PR: https://bitbucket.org/zorotools/%7B03269ff8-c66c-4990-a44c-56a25db86d1d%7D/pull-requests/10500
Adding new functionality to persist return state through browser refreshes via session storage
Story enables store, objects models, as well as pre-populated form. Allows us to share data between components.

Per Luke Bahrou, & Morghan Buhrman, due to complexities found when implementing persisting order return state via browser session storage (needing to refetch some data through other services), this functionality will get its own ticket/story.

Will be restoring previous versions of files.

Nature of the story has changed over the months, and pre-populating ther general contat form is superseded by work on returns-specific contat form. Removing code in contact us form. keeping store/vuex code for contact return flow components
Melanie Maerz see comment below. Nature of ticket changed as we moved from the first iteration of the contact form to our current iteration. No testing required.

Extend front-end state mgmt/store to facilitate/enable cross-component state sharing for contact return form flow.

Added orderReturnDetail property to the store/user module to house returns data;

Added actions for components to set/modify user/orderReturns data;

Added getter for selecting user/orderReturns data;

Added getter for using querying other slices of the state for relevant order/product data;

item.title: [MANAGE-61] [ADA2] Order History - Returns review
item.description:
This description is no longer relevant due to vuetification. See comments below for current.

Order History - Returns page using the SiteImprove plugin, and document any issues aligning to AA compliance level in the ADA2 BGM Audit.

Issues

Button without a text alternative
Buttons should always have a text label. The label can be inserted into the HTML — it does not need to be visible to pass this check.
Visible label and accessible name do not match
The accessible name of any interactive element should contain its visible text label.
State or property not supported
An ARIA attribute has been specified that not supported by this type of element.
Element IDs are not unique
Two or more elements on this page have the same id value. These should be unique.
Page region without an accessible name
Any page section with the role of region should also have an accessible name to identify it.
Text not included in an ARIA landmark
All perceivable text content should be included in an ARIA landmarkhttps://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/examples/landmarks/index.html opens in a new window.
Perceivable text content refers to text that can be perceived by users of assistive technology — some of which may be invisible to sighted users.
Links are not clearly identifiable
Color alone is not enough to distinguish a link from the surrounding text.
Scrollable element is not keyboard accessible
This page has a scrollable section that can't be operated by keyboard.
Issue: Product images contain links that do not have a text alternative. There is no text inside <a>, and no alt or aria.
Compliancy recommendations: Use aria-hide and tab index to make it so there is no keyboard focus.

Recommendations

Make sure all id values are unique within the page.
Provide an accessible name for the region.
Ensure all perceivable text is included in an ARIA landmark.
Add a secondary visual identifier for links.
Make sure that the element can be reached by keyboard.

status.description: Development work that is released or design work that is complete

comments.comment:
Andre Alforque Marjan Bajc

Issue: Product images contain links that do not have a text alternative. There is no text inside <a>, and no alt or aria.

Compliancy recommendations: Use aria-hide and tab index to make it so there is no keyboard focus.
Added aria-label to Return History Search button; determined other issues found for ADA on Return History do not need to be addressed.
Added aria-label to Return History Search button; determined other issues found for ADA on Return History do not need to be addressed.

item.title: [MANAGE-72] [ADA2] Payment detail review
item.description:
Payment detail page using the SiteImprove plugin, and document any issues aligning to AA compliance level in the Vue BGM accessibility audit spreadsheet.

Issues

Link without a text alternative
Links should always have a text alternative. The link text can be inserted into the HTML — it does not need to be visible to pass this check.
Element IDs are not unique
Two or more elements on this page have the same id value. These should be unique.
Page zoom is restricted
The viewport element on this page prevents users from zooming in or scaling text content.
Color contrast is not sufficient
Text on this page does not meet WCAG minimum color-contrast requirements.
Skip to main content link is missing
The first item reached by keyboard should be a link to the main content of the page. This link should be visible when receiving focus from the keyboard.

Recommendations

Provide a text alternative for the link
Make sure all id values are unique within the page
Allow text to be scaled to at least 200%.
Increase the color contrast to 4.5 or higher.
Add a "skip to main content" link at the top of the page. Make sure it's visible when receiving focus.

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

item.title: [MANAGE-58] [ADA2] Sign In | Register page review
item.description:
• Only ADA issues found were for global search field (outside of scope of ticket) and duplicate ids for script tags (to be ignored). See comments for screenshot.*

[Sign In | Register|https://www.zoro.com/sign-in/login] page using the SiteImprove plugin, and document any issues aligning to AA compliance level in the Vue BGM accessibility audit spreadsheet.

Issues

Visible label and accessible name do not match
The accessible name of any interactive element should contain its visible text label.
State or property not supported
An ARIA attribute has been specified that not supported by this type of element.
Element IDs are not unique
Two or more elements on this page have the same id value. These should be unique.
Page region without an accessible name
Any page section with the role of region should also have an accessible name to identify it.
Role not inside the required context
This page element has a role that only makes sense in the context of another role.
Text not included in an ARIA landmark
All perceivable text content should be included in an ARIA landmark opens in a new window.
Perceivable text content refers to text that can be perceived by users of assistive technology — some of which may be invisible to sighted users.
Links are not clearly identifiable
Color alone is not enough to distinguish a link from the surrounding text.
Container element is empty
Some roles are designed to contain other roles. This element has this type of role, but it doesn't contain any required-owned elementshttps://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.1/#mustContain opens in a new window.
Form field is not labeled
Every form element should have a descriptive text label.
Scrollable element is not keyboard accessible
This page has a scrollable section that can't be operated by keyboard.

Recommendations

Include the label text in the accessible name of the element.
Use supported states and properties only.
Make sure all id values are unique within the page.
Provide an accessible name for the region.
Make sure the element is contained by another element that has the required context role.
Ensure all perceivable text is included in an ARIA landmark.
Add a secondary visual identifier for links.
Make sure required-owned elements are nested correctly under the context-giving element.
Add a label, making sure it's properly associated with the form field.
Make sure that the element can be reached by keyboard.

comments.comment: Determined no ADA issues relevant to this story; no changes needed.

Element IDs are not unique
Two or more elements on this page have the same id value. These should be unique.
Text not included in an ARIA landmark
All perceivable text content should be included in an ARIA landmarkhttps://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/examples/landmarks/index.html opens in a new window.
Perceivable text content refers to text that can be perceived by users of assistive technology — some of which may be invisible to sighted users.

Recommendations

Make sure all id values are unique within the page.
Ensure all perceivable text is included in an ARIA landmark.
